title: Hamilton Grange National Memorial: Park Home
body: A founding fatherâ€™s Harlem home.  Alexander Hamilton created the tools for the success of the United States. From his humble beginnings as an orphan on the Caribbean island of Nevis, he became George Washington's right-hand man. Come visit Hamilton Grange and find out more about this controversial founder and the country home that he built on his Harlem estate.              Hamilton Grange on the Move   Hamilton Grange on the way to its new home in St. Nicholas Park.          National Parks of New York Harbor App   National Parks of New York Harbor App
